title: Absence of interactions between social support and stressful life events in the prediction of major depression and depressive symptomatology in women
abstract: There is little evidence to suggest the presence of the buffering effect of social support in the face of adverse life events for women. We suggest that it is important to use alternative models (multiplicative and additive) to examine data, to investigate the match between stressors and social resources, and to investigate fully whether detected interactions actually represent a buffering effect.
